business.headline: Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.
Vandana Vasudevan on how tech is reshaping daily lifeSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan explains how this shift is changing daily routines.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

Jane Street not cooperating in probe with income tax department: ReportThe firm's servers are located outside India, and officials said they are unable to access them. Additionally, accounts books are also being maintained overseas, even though company law requires them to be kept in India.

Planning to buy a car without taking loan? Here's how you can do itThink you need a big salary or bank loan to own a car? Think again. A thoughtful plan, regular savings, and side gigs helped one man save Rs 7.1 lakh in three years, all without borrowing a rupee. Here's how you can do it too.

Explained: Why PNB Housing Finance Ltd shares crashed 18% todayPNB Housing Finance Ltd share crash: The steep fall followed days of weak performance. Over the past five days, the stock has lost 19.59%, and in the last month, it has dropped 26.53%.

New tax rules coming soon. How the Income Tax Bill 2025 could impact youThe new law aims to make income tax rules easier to understand, reduce legal disputes, and help people comply with tax rules more easily.

entertainment.headline: The Kerala Story's Sudipto Sen reacts to Best Director win at National AwardsSudipto Sen won the Best Director for 'The Kerala Story' at the 71st National Film Awards. The film's portrayal of ISIS recruitment sparked debate but gained widespread public support.

Rajinikanth's Coolie gets A certificate ahead of August 14 releaseRajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, earned an A certificate. Featuring a stellar cast and Aamir Khan's special cameo, the film is highly anticipated for its high-octane sequences and will release on August 14 in multiple languages.

Rani Mukerji calls her first National Award as Best Actress deeply personalRani Mukerji won her first National Award for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway' after 30 years in films. She dedicated the award to all mothers and thanked her fans for their love and support.

Tehran trailer: John Abraham battles enemies across borders in action-packed dramaJohn Abraham's upcoming film 'Tehran' is a gripping spy thriller inspired by real events, with a trailer that teases intense action, political drama, and a high-stakes mission. The film, co-starring Manushi Chhillar, will premiere on Zee5 on August 14.

71st National Film Awards: Best Actor, Best Film and more. Full winners' list hereThe 71st National Film Awards were announced in New Delhi, honouring excellence across Indian cinema with Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey sharing Best Actor and Rani Mukerji winning Best Actress. Check out the full winners' list here.

Vikrant Massey-SRK share National Award for Best Actor, Rani Mukerji wins Best ActressVikrant Massey and Shah Rukh Khan won Best Actor for '12th Fail' and 'Jawan' respectively at the 71st National Film Awards. Rani Mukerji bagged Best Actress for her role in 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway'.

Sanya Malhotra's Kathal wins Best Hindi Feature at National Film Awards 2025'Kathal: A Jackfruit Mystery' won Best Hindi Feature at the 71st National Film Awards, announced on August 1. The film was praised for its unique storytelling, strong performances, and socially relevant message.

Janhvi Kapoor-Ishaan Khatter's Homebound to close Indian Film Festival of MelbourneAfter a successful premiere at Cannes, 'Homebound' starring Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa, and Janhvi Kapoor will close the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IFFM) 2025. Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, the film explores friendship, ambition, and the emotional cost of change.

After Sikandar failure, AR Murugadoss says mother-tongue films tap his potentialDirector AR Murugadoss highlights the importance of making films in one's mother-tongue, citing challenges in translating cultural nuances and emotions when working with other languages. His statement comes after the failure of Salman Khan's 'Sikandar'.

WWE Unreal review: Netflix docuseries reveals real drama behind wrestling spectacleRelease Date:Tue Jul 29, 2025'WWE: Unreal' docuseries gives fans a sneak peek into the process, raw emotions and the life of each wrestler. The documentary hits a home run in humanising the world of pro-wrestling for its fans.

Dhadak 2 X reviews: Fans call Triptii-Siddhant's film an unworthy remake'Dhadak 2', starring Triptii Dimri and Siddhant Chaturvedi, released in theatres today and sparked mixed reactions online. While some praised its raw portrayal of caste and love, others criticised it as a weak remake of the Tamil original 'Pariyerum Perumal'.

Hrithik Roshan invites fans for Aavan Jaavan dance contest ahead of War 2 releaseActor Hrithik Roshan has launched a global dance contest for the 'War 2' song 'Aavan Jaavan'. He shared a video , inviting fans worldwide to join and win exciting prizes, ahead of the film's release.

Was dating Aadar Jain a mistake? Tara Sutaria shares details and new loveActor Tara Sutaria shared that she's in a happy place in life and reflected on the missteps she made in her twenties, subtly referencing a past relationship.

Kusha Kapila slams Kaviraj Singh over misogynistic remarks on female influencersKusha Kapila slammed comedian Kaviraj Singh for comparing female influencers to sex workers in a viral video. She said such jokes are harmful and encourage bad behaviour towards women in real life.

Ranveer Allahbadia says he wanted wife so bad, reflects on love amid breakup rumoursYouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia speaks about being single, reflecting on past relationships amid rumours of a breakup with Nikki Sharma.

Aanand L Rai calls AI version of Raanjhanaa a betrayal after producers' statementFilmmaker Aanand L Rai stated in a long note on social media that he neither supports nor approves of the AI-modified version of 'Raanjhanaa', describing it as unauthorised. The film was originally released in 2013.

Housefull 5 OTT release: When and where to watch Akshay Kumar's comedy drama 'Housefull 5', starring Akshay Kumar and Riteish Deshmukh, is now out on Prime Video. Set on a cruise, the film is full of comedy, confusion, and lots of drama as three men claim to be the same person.

Top films and shows to watch on OTT this weekendOTT's new weekend lineup caters to all tastes, featuring a mix of documentaries, anime, dramas, and comedy shows. From thought-provoking political documentaries to thrilling action and heartfelt stories, there is something engaging for every viewer in India.

Exclusive: Sofia Carson, Corey Mylchreest on Bollywood, chemistry, love languageIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, 'My Oxford Year' actors Sofia Carson and Corey Mylchreest spoke about their love for Bollywood and the possibilities of exploring the new sphere.

general news.headline: What India said on White House's call for Nobel Peace Prize for TrumpWhite House has claimed that the global peace deals brokered by Trump average to one per month and has reiterated the call for the Nobel Peace Prize to be awarded to the US President.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.

Avoid deserted areas: Gang attack on Indians in Ireland sparks embassy advisoryAmid a rise in racially motivated assaults on Indians in Ireland, the Indian Embassy in Dublin has issued a safety advisory urging citizens to avoid deserted areas and remain vigilant. Recent incidents include the assault of a 32-year-old Indian man who suffered a fractured cheekbone, and an Amazon employee who was attacked and stripped in Dublin. The Embassy is coordinating with Irish authorities and has provided emergency helpline numbers.

5th Test, Day 2 Live: Krishna, Siraj lead India's comebackIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 5th Test, Day 2 Live Score and Weather Updates: India have clawed their way back into the game as they took six wickets in the second session. Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna have taken 3 wickets each to give visitors a sniff back into the match after a dismal show in the first session.

Story of the crash of Flight AI 171 and a very flighty investigative reportThe Boeing 787 Dreamliner, which was on its way to London, crashed into the BJ Medical College hostel building in Ahmedabad within minutes of take-off on June 12. The tragedy left 260 people dead. Within a month of the AAIB's preliminary investigation report on the crash appearing to have settled blame on the cockpit crew, a veteran pilot shattered the silence with a striking analysis that turned the investigation on its head.

Vikrant Massey-SRK share National Award for Best Actor, Rani Mukerji wins Best ActressVikrant Massey and Shah Rukh Khan won Best Actor for '12th Fail' and 'Jawan' respectively at the 71st National Film Awards. Rani Mukerji bagged Best Actress for her role in 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway'.
Even the phone felt very heavy: Shux on readjusting to life on EarthHe vividly recalled the moment he asked for his phone after landing, and was surprised by how heavy it felt in his hand.
'We look up each time a plane takes off': Inside Ground Zero of Air India crashHow students and faculty at Ahmedabad's Byramjee Jeejeebhoy Medical College are coping with the trauma

Engines dead, pilots glided plane for 120km over ocean, saved 306 livesWhen both engines of Transat Flight 236 from Canada to Portugal died out midair over the Atlantic Ocean in 2001 due to a fuel leak, it was still 120km short of an airstrip. The pilots glided the plane to safety, creating a world record and saving 306 people onboard, in what is now known as the Miracle on the Azores.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

'Sink city' Gurugram: Who is responsible for Millennium City's civic mess?This India Today special campaign for change focusses on the civic collapse in Gurgaon, the Millennium City. Residents, who have invested significantly in luxury properties, find themselves navigating a city plagued by infrastructural failure, especially during monsoons.

Raids on ex-Karnataka clerk unearth Rs 30 crore in assets, including 24 housesA former clerk at Karnataka Rural Infrastructure Development Limited is under investigation after a Lokayukta raid revealed massive wealth, including houses, land and jewellery, worth over Rs 30 crore.

The Real Anand: The Pain Behind Kishore Kumar's MadnessKishore Kumar's eccentricities revealed a paradoxical genius whose soulful voice illuminated millions, masking a life of solitude and inner turmoil.

No comment: New Delhi on Trump's 'Pak will soon sell oil to India' remarkStanding by its decision to purchase oil from Russia, India stated that its choices are guided by the prevailing global scenario and the best available deals in the market to secure the country's energy needs.

Ex-PM Deve Gowda slams Trump's India jibe, calls Opposition his deluded spokespersonAfter US President Donald Trump called India a "dead economy" and imposed hefty tariffs, former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda slammed Trump as volatile and irresponsible. He praised the Modi government's firm response and warned Opposition leaders like Rahul Gandhi against backing Trump's views.

The Naked Gun review: Liam, Pamela's film is ridiculously silly,and it's a good thingRelease Date:Fri Aug 01, 2025Liam Neeson stars as the bumbling detective in The Naked Gun reboot. The film's absurd humour and nostalgic charm bring fresh life to the classic franchise.
One puff, many scars: A journey inside smoker's lungsYou can't rewind lung damage, but you can stop fast-forwarding it. Start with awareness, and let knowledge be your breath of fresh air.

What Sitaare Zameen Par's pay-per-view release on YouTube means for the industryAamir Khan has taken a bold step by releasing his film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' on YouTube via pay-per-view for Rs 100, marking a fresh attempt to revive TVOD in India. This move challenges traditional theatrical norms and aims to leverage YouTube's massive reach.

Indian corporate culture is broken, says Reddit user who quit job after 5 monthsThe user said they were hired without a clear job description, received no structured onboarding, and was left without a reporting manager or any real guidance. From the very first day, they claimed, there was no clarity on their role, no training, and no support system.

Rats spotted on ingredient trays at Lucknow sweet shop, video sparks outrageThe now-viral reel shows the behind-the-scenes process of making the traditional delicacy. However, midway through the video, rats can be seen running across trays of ingredients.

Odisha bureaucrat asks for drinking water, peon gives him bottle of urineA peon in Odisha was arrested for allegedly handing a bottle of urine to his senior officer instead of drinking water, leading to the officer's hospitalisation. The incident occurred in Gajapati district.

Ex-JDS MP Prajwal Revanna convicted for rape, verdict came in just 14 monthsA Karnataka special court has convicted former JDS MP Prajwal Revanna in a rape case filed by a domestic worker. The verdict came just 14 months after a case was filed against him.

What online shopping says about your mindDoes adding to cart feel more satisfying than walking through a mall and browsing stores? This habit might say more about your mental health than you think. While it could just be about convenience, for some, it may reflect deeper needs like comfort, control, or a way to avoid social situations.

sports.headline: New Zealand wipe out Zimbabwe in 1st Test, take 1-0 series leadZIM vs NZ: New Zealand secured a 1-0 lead in the series after beating Zimbabwe by nine wickets in the opening game at the  Queens Sports Club in Bulawayo.

Oval Test: Nice guy Joe Root loses his cool after verbal volley with Prasidh KrishnaEngland vs India, 5th Test: Joe Root lost his cool after fast bowler Prasidh Krishna sledged him during the second session on Day 2. The Indian bowlers were fired up after being taken to the cleaners in the first session on Friday.

Unnecessary? Aakash Deep faces flak for send-off to Ben Duckett in Oval TestIndia fast bowler Akash Deep is facing flak for making unnecessary physical contact with England batter Ben Duckett after dismissing him on Day 2 of the fifth Test against England at the Oval.

34 balls, 6 runs, 4 wickets: India's lower-order blown away on Day 2 morningEngland needed just 34 balls to dismantle the remaining four Indian wickets on a lively second morning at The Oval, bundling the visitors out for a modest 224 — the lowest first-innings total of the series so far.

Jasprit Bumrah released from India squad during final Test at The OvalIndia's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah has been officially released from the squad for the fifth and final Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy against England at The Oval, as part of a pre-determined workload management plan.

End of the road for Pujara, Rahane: Legends left out of Duleep Trophy squadVeteran Indian cricketers Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane have been left out of the West Zone Duleep Trophy squad. This decision could turn out to be a big hit on their Test careers.

Seamer Chris Woakes ruled out of the final Test due to shoulder injuryIndia vs England: England pacer Chris Woakes will play no further part in the 5th Test match, the team announced at the start of Day 2 of the final Test match. Woakes was injured while fielding on Day 1 at The Oval.

Who is Khalid Jamil? The man trusted to lead Indian football's revivalKhalid Jamil has been appointed head coach of the Indian men's national football team, the first Indian in the role in over ten years. His task is to revive Indian football and steer the team to better performances in upcoming tournaments.

India assistant coach reacts to Shubman Gill's unfortunate run outShubman Gill came under fire from fans for a careless run-out on Day 1 of the final Test, with India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate also highlighting the recklessness of the dismissal during the post-match media interaction.

Khalid Jamil announced as new head coach of Indian football teamFormer East Bengal and Mohun Bagan manager Khalid Jamil has been announced as new head coach of Indian football team. Jamil joins the Indian team after the exit of Manolo Marquez.

Shubman Gill's suicidal run-out was game-changer in Oval Test: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has weighed in on Shubman Gill's run-out on Day 1 of the fifth Test between India and England at The Oval, describing it as a game-changing moment that could potentially alter the course of the match.

Oval Test weather report: Will rain affect playing conditions on Day 2?India vs England: The weather played a massive role on Day 1 of the final Test match at The Oval. 6 wickets fell as India struggled to cope up with the movement in overcast conditions.

Galatasaray break Turkish transfer record to sign Victor Osimhen from NapoliGalatasaray have pulled off a stunning coup by signing Nigerian striker Victor Osimhen from Napoli in a record-breaking deal, the club confirmed on Thursday.

I had suicidal thoughts: Chahal breaks silence on divorce sagaYuzvendra Chahal has finally opened up on his divorce with Dhanashree Verma. The spinner spoke about the saga in details on a podcast, explaining his side of the story.

Saim Ayub, Nawaz star for Pakistan as West Indies' horror run continuesWest Indies' poor run in T20 Internationals continued as they slipped to their sixth consecutive defeat, going down by 14 runs against Pakistan in the opening match at Lauderhill.

Shaheen Afridi-Salman Agha controversy: Pakistan refute rift between top starsThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) on Thursday dismissed rumours of a rift involving pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, captain Salman Ali Agha, and head coach Mike Hesson, labelling the allegations as fabricated and defamatory.

Sunil Gavaskar, Sharad Pawar to be honoured with life-size statues at MCA museumLegendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar and veteran cricket administrator Sharad Pawar will be immortalised with life-size statues at the entrance of the upcoming Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) museum.

England seamer Woakes injured; Stokes unlikely to get replacementIndia vs England 5th Test: England will be sweating over Chris Woakes' injury going into the Day 2 of the final Test match at The Oval. Will Woakes be allowed a replacement?

Not looking good: England sweat on Chris Woakes' injury in Oval TestENG vs IND, 5th Test: Gus Atkinson shared an update on Chris Woakes, who walked off the park in the Oval Test after injuring his shoulder while trying to stop the ball from going to the boundary.

India shield Bumrah, but is Siraj carrying the real burden?ENG vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah is being managed for his workload, but what about Mohammed Siraj, who has been a key part of India's fast bowling setup in the purest format?

Bumrah isn't picking and choosing games, team's managing his body: Ten DoeschateEngland vs India: India's assistant coach Ryan Ten Doeschate revealed that fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah isn't picking and choosing games, and the team management is managing his workload to respect his body condition.

ENG vs IND: Karun Nair ends 8-Year wait for fifty, breathes life into career revivalIndia batter Karun Nair ended his eight-year wait for a half-century on Day 1 of the fifth Test against England at the Oval. He scored an unbeaten 52* to help India survive a challenging day under overcast conditions.

Oval Test: Karun Nair's fighting fifty helps India survive challenging Day 1Being asked to bat first under overcast conditions on a green top at the Oval, India managed to survive through the day as Sai Sudharsan and Karun Nair played gritty knocks. Gus Atkinson and Josh Tongue picked two wickets each for England as the hosts managed to scalp six wickets in the day.

Zimbabwe fight on but Conway, Mitchell fifties keep New Zealand in frontNew Zealand maintained their advantage on Day 2 of the second Test against Zimbabwe, with fifties from Devon Conway and Daryl Mitchell securing a valuable first-innings lead.

He makes things simple on the court: Rune delighted to work with AgassiWorld No. 9 Holger Rune described his three-day training camp with Andre Agassi as "insane" and eye-opening, praising the legend for simplifying the game and offering a fresh perspective.

Lucas Paqueta cleared of alleged gambling charges, West Ham confirmsWest Ham's Lucas Paqueta has been cleared of four serious betting rule breaches after an independent FA panel found the charges "not proven."

Conor McGregor loses appeal against civil jury's finding in sexual assault caseConor McGregor has lost his appeal against a civil court ruling that found him liable for sexually assaulting Nikita Hand at a Dublin hotel in 2018. A jury had earlier ruled in Hand's favour, stating McGregor brutally raped and assaulted her in a penthouse.
Max Verstappen confirms Red Bull stay for 2026 seasonMax Verstappen has ended all speculations of a switch to Mercedes as he confirmed that he will be staying at Red Bull for the 2026 season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
